statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Portland State 71, Arizona State 67
article.story: TEMPE, Ariz. (AP) -- Juma Kamara scored 18 points to lead Portland State over Arizona State 71-67 Saturday in non-conference play. Scott Morrison added 16 points and eight rebounds as the Vikings (2-2) held off a second half rally after leading by as much as 18. Jeff Pendergraph had 21 points and 13 rebounds to lead the Sun Devils (1-2). Portland State rode a hot start and then allowed Arizona State to get within 52-50 with 11:11 remaining after a 12-0 Sun Devil run. The Sun Devils cut the deficit to 69-67 with 1:35 left after Serge Angounou hit two of three free throws. Morrison hit a free throw with 1:16 but Arizona State failed to convert on its next possession only to have Portland State turn the ball over again. Christian Polk, who added 20 points for Arizona State, and Derek Glasser each missed one 3-pointer in the final 20 seconds. The Vikings made nine of their first 12 shots to take a 28-12 lead at the midpoint of the first half. But they missed 10 of their next 16 as Arizona State got within 45-35 at the break. Portland State outrebounded Arizona State 20-12 in the first half. Kamara had 16 points and four rebounds in the first half. Both of Arizona State's losses are to Big Sky Conference teams.
